result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE appeared at the counter to set up Pplan @ 12:10 pm & was advised the Pymt Clerk would call him to set up an appt.  I called the DE & advised him to continue the Pplan he is currently on for $75/mo until he gets his final bill from the court with his Attorney's final bill.  DE was advised that his next pymt of $75 is due 4-01-16.  DE also inquired about the bond on 15CF430 & was advised that it was going to be applied to the assessments on 15CF233.  jaf

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Scott Joseph Mariana appeared. Includes 15CF233 and 15CF430. Case called at 11:32 am. ADA Minser recites agreement and files amended information with the court. No objection from Atty Petros.   Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count two and three, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count two and three. Court withholds entering conviction in Count 2 in favor of Diversion Agreement. 15CF430 read in and dismissed for purposes of restitution.O n Count three court orders, 1 year probation w/h with conditions - 
- 30 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge $200.00; Apply Bond
- Restitution $20.00 to Holiday Gas Station in Hammond, WI
- AODA within 30 Days.
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with G. Eckes
- Sign up for probation by 2:00 pm on March 17th, 2016
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Credit for 8 days
Final notice sent, due 3-17-16. cah

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Scott Joseph Mariana appeared. Case called at 11:32. Atty. Petros updates the court, there has not been an official offer as of yet. This case may be headed on a trial track. DE also has an open file with Branch 2. ADA Minser responds and requests another PTC. Court extends one additional pre trial date and notes a possibility for a global resolution. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Scott Joseph Mariana appeared.Case called at 4:30. Court appoints Atty. Petros. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State files an Information.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.
